00208 /* Remeber that NFSv4 manages authentication though junction crossing, and so does it for RO FS management (for each operation) */

00210 {

00212   {nfs4_Compound, nfs4_Compound_Free, (xdrproc_t)xdr_COMPOUND4args, (xdrproc_t)xdr_COMPOUND4res, "nfs4_Compound", NEEDS_CRED|SUPPORTS_GSS }
00213 };

00234 
00245 static void nfs_rpc_execute( nfs_request_data_t * preqnfs, 
00246                              nfs_worker_data_t  * pworker_data )
00247 {
00248   unsigned int                 rpcxid = 0 ;
00249   nfs_function_desc_t          funcdesc ;
00250   exportlist_t               * pexport = NULL ;
00251   nfs_arg_t                    arg_nfs ;
00252   nfs_res_t                    res_nfs ;  
00253   short                        exportid ;
00254   LRU_list_t                 * lru_dupreq = NULL ;
00255   struct svc_req             * ptr_req = &preqnfs->req ;
00256   SVCXPRT                    * ptr_svc = preqnfs->xprt ;
00257   nfs_res_t                    previous_res_nfs ;
00258   nfs_stat_type_t              stat_type ;
00259   struct sockaddr_in           hostaddr;
00260   struct sockaddr_in         * phostaddr ;
00261   cache_inode_status_t         cache_status ;
00262   int                          rc ;
00263   int                          do_dupreq_cache ;
00264   int                          status ;
00265   unsigned int                 i ;
00266   exportlist_client_entry_t    related_client ;
00267   
00268 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS   
00269   static int nb_iter_memleaks = 0 ;
00270 #endif
00271   
00272   /* Get the value from the worker data */
00273   lru_dupreq = pworker_data->duplicate_request ;
00274  
00275 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00276   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCH: Program %d, Version %d, Function %d", 
00277                    ptr_req->rq_prog, ptr_req->rq_vers, ptr_req->rq_proc ) ;
00278 #endif  
00279   /* Initing RPC structure */
00280   memset( &arg_nfs, 0, sizeof( arg_nfs ) ) ;
00281   memset( &res_nfs, 0, sizeof( res_nfs ) ) ;
00282 
00283   /* If we reach this point, there was no dupreq cache hit or no dup req cache was necessary*/
00284   if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program )
00285     {
00286       switch( ptr_req->rq_vers )
00287         {
00288         case NFS_V2:
00289           if( ptr_req->rq_proc > NFSPROC_STATFS )
00290            { 
00291              svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00292              return ;
00293            }
00294           funcdesc = nfs2_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00295           break ;
00296           
00297         case NFS_V3:
00298           if( ptr_req->rq_proc > NFSPROC3_COMMIT )
00299            { 
00300              svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00301              return ;
00302            }
00303           funcdesc = nfs3_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00304           break ;
00305           
00306         case NFS_V4:
00307           if( ptr_req->rq_proc > NFSPROC4_COMPOUND )
00308            { 
00309              svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00310              return ;
00311            }
00312           funcdesc = nfs4_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00313           
00314           /* The export list as a whole is given ti NFSv4 request since NFSv4 is capable of junction traversal */
00315           pexport = nfs_param.pexportlist ;
00316           break ;
00317           
00318         default:
00319           /* We should never go there (this situation is filtered in nfs_rpc_getreq) */ 
00320           DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: NFS Protocol version %d unknown", ptr_req->rq_vers ) ;
00321           svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00322           return ;
00323           break ;
00324         }
00325     }
00326   else if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program )
00327     {
00328       if( ptr_req->rq_proc > MOUNTPROC3_EXPORT ) /* functions are almost the same in MOUNTv1 and MOUNTv3 */
00329        { 
00330          svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00331          return ;
00332        }
00333       
00334       switch( ptr_req->rq_vers )
00335         {
00336         case MOUNT_V1:
00337           funcdesc = mnt1_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00338           break ;
00339           
00340         case MOUNT_V3:
00341           funcdesc = mnt3_func_desc[ptr_req->rq_proc] ;
00342           break ;
00343           
00344         default:
00345           /* We should never go there (this situation is filtered in nfs_rpc_getreq) */ 
00346           DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: MOUNT Protocol version %d unknown", ptr_req->rq_vers ) ;
00347           svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00348           return ;
00349           break ;
00350           
00351         } /* switch( ptr_req->vers ) */
00352     }
00353   else
00354     {
00355       /* We should never go there (this situation is filtered in nfs_rpc_getreq) */ 
00356       DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCHER: protocol %d is not managed", ptr_req->rq_prog ) ;
00357       svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00358       return ;
00359     } /* switch( ptr_req->rq_prog ) */
00360 
00361 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00362   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Before svc_getargs on socket %u, xprt=%p", ptr_svc->xp_sock, ptr_svc ) ;
00363 #endif
00364 
00365   if( svc_getargs( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_decode_func, (caddr_t)&arg_nfs ) == FALSE )
00366     {
00367       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJ, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Error while calling svc_getargs" ) ;
00368       svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00369       return ;
00370     }
00371 
00372   /* Tag myself as currently processing this request */
00373   rpcxid = get_rpc_xid( ptr_req ) ;
00374  
00375   /* Is this request already managed by another thread ? 
00376    * In this case, do not handle the request to avoid thread starvation 
00377    * because this shows that the FSAL may hang in a specific call */
00378   for( i = 0 ; i <  nfs_param.core_param.nb_worker ; i++ )
00379     {
00380         if( workers_data[i].current_xid == rpcxid )
00381           {
00382              DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJOR, "Dupreq #%u was asked for process since another thread manage it, reject for avoiding threads starvation...", rpcxid ) ;
00383 
00384             /* Free the arguments */
00385             if( !SVC_FREEARGS( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_decode_func, (caddr_t)&arg_nfs ) )
00386               {
00387                 DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Bad SVC_FREEARGS for %s", funcdesc.funcname ) ;
00388               }
00389              return ;
00390           }
00391     }
00392 
00393   /* Manage this request, so keeps its xid in worker_data specific structure */
00394   pworker_data->current_xid = rpcxid ;
00395 
00396 
00397     /* Getting the xid from the RPC request (this value is used for RPC duplicate request hash */
00398   if( ( do_dupreq_cache = funcdesc.dispatch_behaviour & CAN_BE_DUP )  )
00399     {
00400       rpcxid = get_rpc_xid( ptr_req ) ;
00401 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00402       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCH: Request has xid=%u", rpcxid ) ;
00403 #endif
00404       previous_res_nfs= nfs_dupreq_get( rpcxid, &status ) ;
00405       if( status == DUPREQ_SUCCESS )
00406         {
00407           /* Request was known, use the previous reply */
00408 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00409           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00410                            "NFS DISPATCHER: DupReq Cache Hit: using previous reply, rpcxid=%u", 
00411                            rpcxid ) ;
00412 #endif
00413 
00414 
00415 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00416           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Before svc_sendreply on socket %u", ptr_svc->xp_sock ) ;
00417 #endif
00418           if( svc_sendreply( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_encode_func, (caddr_t)&previous_res_nfs ) == FALSE )
00419             {
00420               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Error while calling svc_sendreply" ) ;
00421               svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00422             }
00423           return ; /* exit the function */
00424         }
00425     }
00426 
00427 
00428   /* Get the export entry */
00429   if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program )
00430     {
00431       /* The NFSv2 and NFSv3 functions'arguments always begin with the file handle (but not the NULL function)
00432        * this hook is used to get the fhandle with the arguments and so 
00433        * determine the export entry to be used.
00434        * In NFSv4, junction traversal is managed by the protocol itself so the whole
00435        * export list is provided to NFSv4 request. */
00436       
00437       switch( ptr_req->rq_vers )
00438         {
00439         case NFS_V2:
00440           if( ptr_req->rq_proc != NFSPROC_NULL ) 
00441             {
00442               exportid = nfs2_FhandleToExportId( ( fhandle2 *)&arg_nfs ) ;
00443 
00444               if( exportid < 0 ) 
00445                 {
00446                   /* Bad argument */
00447                   svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_FAILED ) ;
00448                 }
00449 
00450               if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( nfs_param.pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
00451                 {
00452                   /* Reject the request for authentication reason (incompatible file handle */
00453                   svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_FAILED ) ;
00454                 }
00455               
00456 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATH
00457               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Found export entry for dirname=%s as exportid=%d", 
00458                                pexport->dirname, pexport->id ) ;
00459 #endif
00460             }
00461           
00462           break ;
00463           
00464         case NFS_V3:
00465           if( ptr_req->rq_proc != NFSPROC_NULL ) 
00466             {
00467               exportid = nfs3_FhandleToExportId( ( nfs_fh3 *)&arg_nfs ) ;
00468               if( exportid < 0 )
00469                 {
00470                   char dumpfh[1024] ;
00471                   /* Reject the request for authentication reason (incompatible file handle) */
00472                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJ,
00473                                    "/!\\ | Host 0x%x = %d.%d.%d.%d has badly formed file handle, vers=%d, proc=%d FH=%s",
00474                                    ntohs( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ),
00475                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0xFF000000 ) >> 24,
00476                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x00FF0000 ) >> 16,
00477                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x0000FF00 ) >> 8,
00478                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x000000FF ),
00479                                    ptr_req->rq_vers,
00480                                    ptr_req->rq_proc,
00481                                    dumpfh ) ;
00482                   svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_FAILED ) ;
00483                   return ;
00484                 }
00485 
00486               if( ( pexport = nfs_Get_export_by_id( nfs_param.pexportlist, exportid ) ) == NULL )
00487                 {
00488                   char dumpfh[1024] ;
00489                   /* Reject the request for authentication reason (incompatible file handle) */
00490                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJ, 
00491                                    "/!\\ | Host 0x%x = %d.%d.%d.%d has badly formed file handle, vers=%d, proc=%d FH=%s",
00492                                    ntohs( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ), 
00493                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0xFF000000 ) >> 24, 
00494                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x00FF0000 ) >> 16, 
00495                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x0000FF00 ) >> 8, 
00496                                    ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x000000FF ), 
00497                                    ptr_req->rq_vers, 
00498                                    ptr_req->rq_proc,
00499                                    dumpfh  ) ;
00500                   svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_FAILED ) ;
00501                   return ;
00502                 }
00503              
00504 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00505               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Found export entry for dirname=%s as exportid=%d", 
00506                                pexport->dirname, pexport->id ) ;
00507 #endif
00508             }
00509           break ;
00510           
00511         case NFS_V4:
00512           pexport = nfs_param.pexportlist ;
00513           break ;
00514         } /* switch( ptr_req->rq_vers ) */
00515     }
00516   else if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program )
00517     {
00518       /* Always use the whole export list for mount protocol */
00519       pexport = nfs_param.pexportlist ;
00520     } /* switch( ptr_req->rq_prog ) */
00521 
00522   /* Do not call a MAKES_WRITE function on a read-only export entry */
00523   if( ( funcdesc.dispatch_behaviour & MAKES_WRITE ) 
00524       && ( pexport->access_type == ACCESSTYPE_RO || 
00525            pexport->access_type == ACCESSTYPE_MDONLY_RO ) )
00526     {
00527       if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program )
00528         {
00529           if( ptr_req->rq_vers == NFS_V2 )
00530             {
00531               /* All the nfs_res structure in V2 have the status at the same place (because it is an union) */
00532               res_nfs.res_attr2.status = NFSERR_ROFS;
00533               rc = NFS_REQ_OK ; /* Processing of the request is done */
00534             }
00535           else 
00536             {
00537               /* V3 request */
00538               /* All the nfs_res structure in V2 have the status at the same place, and so does V3 ones */
00539               res_nfs.res_attr2.status = (nfsstat2) NFS3ERR_ROFS; 
00540               rc = NFS_REQ_OK ; /* Processing of the request is done */
00541             }
00542         }
00543       else /* unexpected protocol (mount doesn't make write) */
00544         rc = NFS_REQ_DROP ;
00545     }
00546   else
00547     {
00548       /* This is not a MAKES_WRITE call done on a read-only export entry */
00549 
00550       /* 
00551        * It is now time for checking if export list allows the machine to perform the request 
00552        */
00553 
00554       /* Ask the RPC layer for the adresse of the machine */
00555       phostaddr = svc_getcaller( ptr_svc ) ;
00556       memcpy( &hostaddr, phostaddr, sizeof( hostaddr ) );
00557      
00558       /* Keep this value into the worker's data structure */
00559       pworker_data->hostaddr = (unsigned int)( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr );
00560 
00561       /* Check if client is using a privileged port, but only for NFS protocol */
00562       if( ptr_req->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program && ptr_req->rq_proc != 0 ) 
00563         {
00564           if(  ( pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_PRIVILEGED_PORT ) &&
00565                 ( ntohs( hostaddr.sin_port ) >= IPPORT_RESERVED ) ) 
00566                 {
00567                         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "/!\\ | Port %d is too high for this export entry, rejecting client", hostaddr.sin_port ) ;
00568                         svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_TOOWEAK ) ;
00569                         pworker_data->current_xid = 0 ; /* No more xid managed */
00570                         return ;
00571                 }
00572         }
00573 
00574       if( nfs_export_check_access( (unsigned int)( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ),
00575                                    ptr_req, 
00576                                    pexport,
00577                                    nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program,
00578                                    nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program,
00579                                    pworker_data->ht_ip_stats,
00580                                    pworker_data->ip_stats_pool,
00581                                    &related_client ) == FALSE )
00582          {
00583           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, 
00584                            "/!\\ | Host 0x%x = %d.%d.%d.%d is not allowed to access this export entry, vers=%d, proc=%d",
00585                            ntohs( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ), 
00586                            ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0xFF000000 ) >> 24, 
00587                            ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x00FF0000 ) >> 16, 
00588                            ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x0000FF00 ) >> 8, 
00589                            ( ntohl( hostaddr.sin_addr.s_addr ) & 0x000000FF ), 
00590                            ptr_req->rq_vers, 
00591                            ptr_req->rq_proc ) ;
00592           /* svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_TOOWEAK ) ;*/
00593           pworker_data->current_xid = 0 ; /* No more xid managed */
00594           return ; 
00595          }
00596       
00597       /* Do the authentication stuff, if needed */
00598       if( funcdesc.dispatch_behaviour & NEEDS_CRED )
00599         {
00600           if( nfs_build_fsal_context( ptr_req, &related_client, pexport, &pworker_data->thread_fsal_context ) == FALSE )
00601             {
00602               svcerr_auth( ptr_svc, AUTH_TOOWEAK );
00603               pworker_data->current_xid = 0 ; /* No more xid managed */
00604               return ;
00605             }
00606         }
00607 
00608       /* processing */
00609 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFSPROTO
00610       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCHER: Calling service function %s", funcdesc.funcname ) ;
00611 #endif
00612       rc = funcdesc.service_function( &arg_nfs, 
00613                                       pexport, 
00614                                       &pworker_data->thread_fsal_context,
00615                                       &(pworker_data->cache_inode_client),
00616                                       pworker_data->ht,
00617                                       ptr_req, 
00618                                       &res_nfs ) ; /* BUGAZOMEU Un appel crade pour debugger */
00619 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00620       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCHER: Function %s exited with status %d", funcdesc.funcname, rc ) ;
00621 #endif
00622     }
00623   
00624   /* Perform statistics here */
00625   stat_type = ( rc == NFS_REQ_OK ) ? GANESHA_STAT_SUCCESS : GANESHA_STAT_DROP ;
00626 
00627   nfs_stat_update( stat_type, &(pworker_data->stats.stat_req) , ptr_req ) ; 
00628   pworker_data->stats.nb_total_req  += 1 ;
00629 
00630   pworker_data->current_xid = 0 ; /* No more xid managed */
00631 
00632   /* If request is dropped, no return to the client */ 
00633   if( rc == NFS_REQ_DROP )
00634     { 
00635      /* The request was dropped */
00636      DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Drop request rpc_xid=%u, program %u, version %u, function %u", 
00637                       rpcxid, ptr_req->rq_prog, ptr_req->rq_vers, ptr_req->rq_proc  ) ;
00638     }
00639   else
00640     {
00641 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00642       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Before svc_sendreply on socket %u", ptr_svc->xp_sock ) ;
00643 #endif
00644 
00645       /* encoding the result on xdr output */
00646       if( svc_sendreply( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_encode_func, (caddr_t)&res_nfs ) == FALSE )
00647         {
00648           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Error while calling svc_sendreply" ) ;
00649           svcerr_decode( ptr_svc ) ;
00650           return ;
00651         }
00652   
00653       /* store in dupreq cache if needed */
00654       if( do_dupreq_cache )
00655         {
00656           if( nfs_dupreq_add( rpcxid, ptr_req, &res_nfs, lru_dupreq, &pworker_data->dupreq_pool ) != DUPREQ_SUCCESS )
00657             {
00658               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Bad insertion in dupreq cache" ) ;
00659             }
00660         }
00661      } 
00662   /* Free the allocated resources once the work is done */
00663 
00664   /* Free the arguments */
00665   if( !SVC_FREEARGS( ptr_svc, funcdesc.xdr_decode_func, (caddr_t)&arg_nfs ) )
00666     {
00667       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Bad SVC_FREEARGS for %s", funcdesc.funcname ) ;
00668     }
00669   
00670   /* Free the reply.
00671    * This should not be done if the request is dupreq cached because this will
00672    * mark the dupreq cached info eligible for being reuse by other requests */
00673   if( !do_dupreq_cache )
00674     {
00675       /* Free only the non dropped requests */
00676       if( rc == NFS_REQ_OK ) 
00677          funcdesc.free_function( &res_nfs ) ;
00678     }
00679 
00680 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00681   if( nb_iter_memleaks > 1000 )
00682     {
00683       nb_iter_memleaks = 0  ;
00684       /* BuddyDumpMem( stdout ) ; */
00685       nfs_debug_debug_label_info() ;
00686 
00687       printf( "Stats de ce thread: total mnt1=%u mnt3=%u nfsv2=%u nfsv3=%u nfsv4=%u\n",
00688               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_mnt1_req,
00689               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_mnt3_req,
00690               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_nfs2_req,
00691               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_nfs3_req,
00692               pworker_data->stats.stat_req.nb_nfs4_req ) ;
00693               
00694     }
00695   else
00696     nb_iter_memleaks += 1 ;
00697 #endif
00698 
00699   return ;
00700 } /* nfs_rpc_execute */
00701 
00702 
00703 
00704 
00718 int nfs_Init_worker_data( nfs_worker_data_t * pdata ) 
00719 {
00720   LRU_parameter_t lru_param ;
00721   LRU_status_t status = LRU_LIST_SUCCESS ;
00722   pthread_mutexattr_t mutexattr ;
00723   pthread_condattr_t  condattr ;
00724   int j = 0 ;
00725   
00726   if( pthread_mutexattr_init( &mutexattr ) != 0 )
00727     return -1 ;
00728 
00729   if( pthread_condattr_init( &condattr ) != 0 )
00730     return -1 ;
00731 
00732   if( pthread_mutex_init( &(pdata->mutex_req_condvar), &mutexattr ) !=0 )
00733     return -1 ;
00734   
00735   if( pthread_mutex_init( &(pdata->request_pool_mutex), &mutexattr ) !=0 )
00736     return -1 ;
00737   
00738   if( pthread_cond_init( &(pdata->req_condvar), &condattr ) != 0 )
00739     return -1 ;
00740   
00741   if( ( pdata->pending_request = LRU_Init( nfs_param.worker_param.lru_param, &status ) ) == NULL )
00742     {
00743       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_LRU, ERR_LRU_LIST_INIT, status ) ;
00744       return -1 ;
00745     }
00746 
00747   if( ( pdata->duplicate_request = LRU_Init( nfs_param.worker_param.lru_dupreq, &status ) ) == NULL )
00748     {
00749       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_LRU, ERR_LRU_LIST_INIT, status ) ;
00750       return -1 ;
00751     }
00752     
00753   pdata->passcounter = 0 ;  
00754   pdata->is_ready = FALSE ;
00755   pdata->gc_in_progress = FALSE ;
00756 
00757   return 0 ;
00758 } /* nfs_Init_worker_data */
00759 
00760 
00773 void * worker_thread( void * IndexArg )
00774 {
00775   nfs_worker_data_t    * pmydata ;
00776   nfs_request_data_t   * pnfsreq ;
00777   LRU_entry_t          * pentry ;
00778   char                 * cred_area;
00779   struct rpc_msg       * pmsg;
00780   struct svc_req       * preq ;
00781   SVCXPRT              * xprt ;
00782   enum auth_stat         why ;
00783   long                   index  ;
00784   bool_t                 found = FALSE ;
00785   int                    rc    = 0 ;
00786   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00787   unsigned int           gc_allowed = FALSE ;
00788   char                   thr_name[128];
00789   char                   auth_str[AUTH_STR_LEN] ;
00790   bool_t                 no_dispatch = FALSE ;
00791 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
00792   struct rpc_gss_cred  * gc;
00793 #endif 
00794 
00795   index = (long)IndexArg ;
00796   pmydata= &(workers_data[index]) ;
00797   
00798   snprintf(thr_name, 128, "worker#%ld", index);
00799   SetNameFunction( thr_name ) ;  
00800   
00801 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00802   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d : Starting, nb_entry=%d",
00803                    index, pmydata->pending_request->nb_entry ) ;
00804 #endif
00805   /* Initialisation of the Buddy Malloc */ 
00806 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00807   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d : Initialization of memory manager", index ) ;
00808 #endif
00809 
00810 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00811   if ( ( rc = BuddyInit( &nfs_param.buddy_param_worker )) != BUDDY_SUCCESS )
00812     {
00813       /* Failed init */
00814       DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Memory manager could not be initialized, exiting...", index ) ;
00815       exit( 1 ) ;
00816     }
00817   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Memory manager successfully initialized", index ) ;
00818 #endif
00819 
00820   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: my pthread id is %p", index, (caddr_t)pthread_self() ) ;
00821 
00822   /* Initialisation of credential for current thread */ 
00823   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Initialization of thread's credential", index ) ;
00824   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( FSAL_InitClientContext( &pmydata->thread_fsal_context )) )
00825     {
00826       /* Failed init */
00827       DisplayLog( "NFS  WORKER #%d: Error initing thread's credential", index ) ;
00828       exit( 1 ) ;
00829     }
00830       
00831       
00832   /* Init the Cache inode client for this worker */
00833   if( cache_inode_client_init( &pmydata->cache_inode_client,
00834                                nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_inode_client_param,
00835                                index, 
00836                                pmydata ) )
00837     {
00838       /* Failed init */
00839       DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Cache Inode client could not be initialized, exiting...", index ) ;
00840       exit( 1 ) ;
00841     }
00842   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Cache Inode client successfully initialized", index ) ;
00843   
00844   /* Init the Cache content client for this worker */
00845   if( cache_content_client_init( &pmydata->cache_content_client,
00846                                  nfs_param.cache_layers_param.cache_content_client_param ) )
00847     {
00848       /* Failed init */
00849       DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Cache Content client could not be initialized, exiting...", index ) ;
00850       exit( 1 ) ;
00851     }
00852   DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: Cache Content client successfully initialized", index ) ;
00853 
00854   /* The worker thread is not garbagging anything at the time it starts */
00855   pmydata->gc_in_progress = FALSE ;
00856   
00857   /* Bind the data cache client to the inode cache client */
00858   pmydata->cache_inode_client.pcontent_client = (caddr_t)&pmydata->cache_content_client ;
00859   
00860   /* notify dispatcher it is ready */
00861   pmydata->is_ready = TRUE;  
00862   
00863   /* Worker's infinite loop */
00864   while( 1 )
00865     {
00866       
00867       /* update memory and FSAL stats,
00868        * twice often than stats display.
00869        */
00870       if ( time(NULL) - pmydata->stats.last_stat_update > 
00871            (int)nfs_param.core_param.stats_update_delay / 2 )
00872       {
00873         
00874         FSAL_get_stats( &pmydata->stats.fsal_stats, FALSE );
00875         
00876 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00877         BuddyGetStats( &pmydata->stats.buddy_stats ) ;
00878 #endif
00879         /* reset last stat */
00880         pmydata->stats.last_stat_update = time( NULL );
00881       }
00882       
00883       /* Wait on condition variable for work to be done */
00884 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00885       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: waiting for requests to process, nb_entry=%d, nb_invalid=%d", 
00886                        index, pmydata->pending_request->nb_entry, pmydata->pending_request->nb_invalid  ) ;   
00887 #endif
00888       P( pmydata->mutex_req_condvar ) ;
00889       while( pmydata->pending_request->nb_entry == pmydata->pending_request->nb_invalid )
00890         pthread_cond_wait( &(pmydata->req_condvar), &(pmydata->mutex_req_condvar) ) ;
00891 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00892       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: Processing a new request", index ) ;
00893 #endif
00894       found = FALSE ;
00895       P( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
00896       for( pentry = pmydata->pending_request->LRU ; pentry != NULL ; pentry = pentry->next )
00897         {
00898           if( pentry->valid_state == LRU_ENTRY_VALID )
00899             {
00900               found = TRUE ;
00901               break ;
00902             }
00903         }
00904       
00905       if( !found )
00906         {
00907           V( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
00908           V( pmydata->mutex_req_condvar ) ;
00909           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_MAJOR, "NFS WORKER #%d : No pending request available", index ) ;
00910           continue ; /* return to main loop */
00911         }
00912      
00913       pnfsreq = (nfs_request_data_t *)(pentry->buffdata.pdata ) ;
00914       V(  pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ; 
00915       V( pmydata->mutex_req_condvar ) ;
00916 
00917 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00918       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d : I have some work to do, length=%d, invalid=%d",
00919                        index, 
00920                        pmydata->pending_request->nb_entry,
00921                        pmydata->pending_request->nb_invalid ) ;
00922 #endif
00923       
00924       if( pnfsreq->xprt->xp_sock == 0 )
00925         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d:No RPC management, xp_sock==0", index ) ;
00926       else
00927         { 
00928           /* Set pointers */
00929           cred_area = pnfsreq->cred_area;
00930           pmsg = &(pnfsreq->msg) ;
00931           preq = &(pnfsreq->req );
00932           xprt = pnfsreq->xprt ;
00933    
00934 
00935           /*do */
00936             {
00937               if( pnfsreq->status )
00938                 {
00939                   preq->rq_xprt = pnfsreq->xprt ;
00940                   preq->rq_prog = pmsg->rm_call.cb_prog;
00941                   preq->rq_vers = pmsg->rm_call.cb_vers;
00942                   preq->rq_proc = pmsg->rm_call.cb_proc;
00943 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH                  
00944                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Prog = %d, vers = %d, proc = %d",
00945                                    pmsg->rm_call.cb_prog, pmsg->rm_call.cb_vers, pmsg->rm_call.cb_proc ) ;
00946 #endif
00947                   /* Restore previously save GssData */
00948 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
00949                   no_dispatch = FALSE ;
00950                   if( ( why = Rpcsecgss__authenticate( preq, pmsg, &no_dispatch) ) != AUTH_OK )
00951 #else
00952                   if( ( why = _authenticate( preq, pmsg) ) != AUTH_OK)
00953 #endif
00954                     {
00955                         auth_stat2str( why, auth_str ) ;
00956                         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "Could not authenticate request... rejecting with AUTH_STAT=%s", auth_str ) ;
00957                         svcerr_auth( xprt, why);
00958                     }
00959                   else
00960                     {
00961 #ifdef _USE_GSSRPC
00962                       if( preq->rq_xprt->xp_verf.oa_flavor == RPCSEC_GSS )
00963                         {
00964                           gc = (struct rpc_gss_cred *)preq->rq_clntcred;
00965 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
00966                           printf( "========> no_dispatch=%u gc->gc_proc=%u RPCSEC_GSS_INIT=%u RPCSEC_GSS_CONTINUE_INIT=%u RPCSEC_GSS_DATA=%u RPCSEC_GSS_DESTROY=%u\n",
00967                                    no_dispatch, gc->gc_proc, RPCSEC_GSS_INIT, RPCSEC_GSS_CONTINUE_INIT, RPCSEC_GSS_DATA, RPCSEC_GSS_DESTROY ) ;
00968 #endif /* _DEBUG_DISPATCH */
00969                         }
00970 #endif                      
00971                       /* A few words of explanation are required here:
00972                        * In authentication is AUTH_NONE or AUTH_UNIX, then the value of no_dispatch remains FALSE and the request is proceeded normally
00973                        * If authentication is RPCSEC_GSS, no_dispatch may have value TRUE, this means that gc->gc_proc != RPCSEC_GSS_DATA and that the 
00974                        * message is in fact an internal negociation message from RPCSEC_GSS using GSSAPI. It then should not be proceed by the worker and
00975                        * SCV_STAT should be returned to the dispatcher */
00976                       if( no_dispatch == FALSE )
00977                         {
00978                           if( preq->rq_prog != nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program )
00979                             {
00980                               if( preq->rq_prog != nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program )
00981                                 {
00982                                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "/!\\ | Invalid Program number #%d",  preq->rq_prog ) ;
00983                                   svcerr_noprog( xprt ); /* This is no NFS or MOUNT program, exit... */
00984                                 }
00985                               else
00986                                 {
00987                                   /* Call is with MOUNTPROG */
00988                                   if( ( preq->rq_vers != MOUNT_V1) &&
00989                                       ( preq->rq_vers != MOUNT_V3) )
00990                                     {
00991                                       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "/!\\ | Invalid Mount Version #%d", preq->rq_vers ) ;
00992                                       svcerr_progvers( xprt, MOUNT_V1, MOUNT_V3 ) ; /* Bad MOUNT version */
00993                                     }
00994                                   else
00995                                     {
00996                                       /* Actual work starts here */
00997                                       nfs_rpc_execute( pnfsreq, pmydata ) ;
00998                                     }
00999                                 }
01000                             }
01001                           else 
01002                             {
01003                               /* If we go there, preq->rq_prog ==  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program */ 
01004 #ifndef _USE_PROXY /* FSAL_PROXY supports only NFSv4 */
01005                               if( ( preq->rq_vers != NFS_V2) &&
01006                                   ( preq->rq_vers != NFS_V3) &&
01007                                   ( preq->rq_vers != NFS_V4) )
01008 #else
01009                               if( preq->rq_vers != NFS_V4 )
01010 #endif
01011                                 {
01012                                   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "/!\\ | Invalid NFS Version #%d", preq->rq_vers ) ;
01013 #ifndef _USE_PROXY
01014                                   svcerr_progvers( xprt, NFS_V2, NFS_V4 ); /* Bad NFS version */
01015 #else
01016                                   svcerr_progvers( xprt, NFS_V4, NFS_V4 ); /* Bad NFS version */
01017 #endif
01018                                 }
01019                               else 
01020                                 {
01021                                   /* Actual work starts here */
01022                                   nfs_rpc_execute( pnfsreq, pmydata ) ;
01023                                 }
01024                             } /* else from if( preq->rq_prog !=  nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program ) */ 
01025                          } /* if( no_dispatch == FALSE ) */
01026                     } /* else from if( ( why = _authenticate( preq, pmsg) ) != AUTH_OK) */
01027                 } /* if( pnfsreq->status ) */
01028             } /* while (  pnfsreq->status == XPRT_MOREREQS ); Now handle at the dispatcher's level */
01029 
01030         }
01031       
01032       /* Free the req by releasing the entry */
01033 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01034       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS DISPATCH: Invalidating processed entry with xprt_stat=%d", 
01035                        pnfsreq->status ) ;
01036 #endif
01037       P( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
01038       if( LRU_invalidate( pmydata->pending_request, pentry ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01039         {
01040           DisplayLog( "NFS DISPATCH: Incoherency: released entry for dispatch could not be tagged invalid") ;
01041         }
01042      V( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
01043 
01044       
01045       if( pmydata->passcounter > nfs_param.worker_param.nb_before_gc )
01046         {
01047           /* Garbagge collection on dup req cache */
01048 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01049           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS_WORKER #%d: before dupreq invalidation nb_entry=%d nb_invalid=%d", 
01050                            index, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_entry, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_invalid ) ;
01051 #endif
01052           if( (rc = LRU_invalidate_by_function( pmydata->duplicate_request, nfs_dupreq_gc_function, NULL )) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01053             {
01054               DisplayLog( "NFS WORKER #%d: FAILURE: Impossible to invalidate entries for duplicate request cache (error %d)",
01055                           index, rc ) ;
01056             }
01057 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH          
01058           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "NFS_WORKER #%d: after dupreq invalidation nb_entry=%d nb_invalid=%d", 
01059                            index, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_entry, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_invalid ) ;
01060 #endif
01061           if( (rc = LRU_gc_invalid( pmydata->duplicate_request, (void *)&pmydata->dupreq_pool)) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01062             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "NFS WORKER #%d: FAILURE: Impossible to gc entries for duplicate request cache (error %d)", 
01063                              index, rc ) ;
01064           else
01065             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: gc entries for duplicate request cache OK", index ) ;
01066 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH          
01067           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS_WORKER #%d: after dupreq gc nb_entry=%d nb_invalid=%d", 
01068                            index, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_entry, pmydata->duplicate_request->nb_invalid ) ;
01069 
01070           /* Performing garbabbge collection */
01071           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: garbagge collecting on pending request list", index ) ;
01072 #endif
01073           pmydata->passcounter = 0 ;
01074           P( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
01075 
01076           if( LRU_gc_invalid( pmydata->pending_request, (void *)&pmydata->request_pool ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01077             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, 
01078                              "NFS WORKER #%d: ERROR: Impossible garbagge collection on pending request list",
01079                              index ) ;
01080           else
01081             DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: garbagge collection on pending request list OK", index ) ;
01082           
01083           V( pmydata->request_pool_mutex ) ;
01084 
01085         }
01086 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH          
01087       else
01088         DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "NFS WORKER #%d: garbagge collection isn't necessary count=%d, max=%d", 
01089                          index, pmydata->passcounter, nfs_param.worker_param.nb_before_gc ) ;
01090 #endif
01091       pmydata->passcounter += 1 ;
01092 
01093       /* In case of the use of TCP, commit the dispatcher */
01094       if( pnfsreq->ipproto == IPPROTO_TCP )
01095        {
01096          P( mutex_cond_xprt[xprt->xp_sock] ) ;
01097          etat_xprt[xprt->xp_sock] = 1 ;
01098          pthread_cond_signal( &(condvar_xprt[xprt->xp_sock]) ) ;
01099          V( mutex_cond_xprt[xprt->xp_sock] ) ;
01100        }
01101  
01102       /* If needed, perform garbagge collection on cache_inode layer */
01103       P( lock_nb_current_gc_workers )  ;
01104       if( nb_current_gc_workers <= nfs_param.core_param.nb_max_concurrent_gc )
01105         {
01106           nb_current_gc_workers += 1 ; 
01107           gc_allowed = TRUE ;
01108         }
01109       else
01110         gc_allowed = FALSE ;
01111       V( lock_nb_current_gc_workers )  ;
01112 
01113       if( gc_allowed == TRUE )
01114         {
01115           pmydata->gc_in_progress = TRUE ;
01116 #ifdef _DEBUG_DISPATCH
01117           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_DEBUG, "There are %d concurrent garbagge collection", nb_current_gc_workers ) ;
01118 #endif
01119 
01120           if( cache_inode_gc( pmydata->ht, 
01121                               &(pmydata->cache_inode_client), 
01122                               &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) 
01123             {
01124               DisplayLogLevel( NIV_CRIT, "NFS DISPATCHER: FAILURE: Bad cache_inode garbagge collection" ) ;
01125             }
01126          
01127           
01128           if( LRU_invalidate_by_function( pmydata->cache_content_client.lru_gc, 
01129                                           cache_content_invalidate_flushed, 
01130                                           (void*)&pmydata->cache_content_client ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01131             {
01132                  DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS WORKER #%d : Can't invalidate LRU GC for datacache", index ) ;
01133             }
01134 
01135          /* Removes the LRU entries and put them back to the pool */
01136          if( LRU_gc_invalid( pmydata->cache_content_client.lru_gc, NULL ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01137             {
01138                  DisplayLogLevel( NIV_EVENT, "NFS WORKER #%d : Can't get ride of datacache invalid LRU GC entries", index ) ;
01139             }
01140  
01141           P( lock_nb_current_gc_workers )  ;
01142           nb_current_gc_workers -= 1 ;
01143           V( lock_nb_current_gc_workers )  ;
01144 
01145           pmydata->gc_in_progress = FALSE ; 
01146         }
01147 
01148 
01149     } /* while( 1 ) */
01150   return NULL ;
01151 } /* worker_thread */
01152
